poem:
Title: Between Shadow and Solemnity

A politician's discourse,
both curt and carmine—
'South Dakota' and 'inexcusable'
share a morning's headline.
O, the mockery of wind!

Scathing rod now weaved into laurel,
much like ripe peaches forgotten
on an autumn kitchen table.
Naught but clarity in the mirror
of these public antics,
a circus with no tent.
Doubt blossoms, yet the game continues
in the whisper of the prairie.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Senior Republican who called Trump ‘inexcusable’ endorses him for president The No2 Republican in the US Senate, John Thune of South Dakota, endorsed for president Donald Trump – the man he previously called “inexcusable” for seeking to overturn the 2020 election and inciting the deadly January 6 attack on Congress. Related: The Michigan Republican party is already in chaos. What will Tuesday bring? Multiple media outlets reported Thune’s endorsement. They also swiftly pointed out statements". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Senior Republican who called Trump ‘inexcusable’ endorses him for president The No2 Republican in the US Senate, John Thune of South Dakota, endorsed for president Donald Trump – the man he previously called “inexcusable” for seeking to overturn the 2020 election and inciting the deadly January 6 attack on Congress. Related: The Michigan Republican party is already in chaos. What will Tuesday bring? Multiple media outlets reported Thune’s endorsement. They also swiftly pointed out statements
